definition: polyphony
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
character with two or more readings
character having several readings and meanings
polysyllabic word/Chinese word made up of three or more characters

sentences.english: The command of the accurate pronunciation of polyphonic characters is the key to the standardization of Chinese character pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 准确掌握多音异读字是人们规范认读汉字的关键。

sentences.english: Multi-tone support for cable tracing and fault isolation.
sentences.chinese: 多音电缆故障隔离追踪和支持。

sentences.english: This paper investigates the shortwave multitone parallel modem.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要研究了短波多音并行调制解调器。

definition: character with two or more readings
phonetic value of a character
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
character having several readings and meanings
homophonic characters
phoneme
bisyllable
sound and meaning
phonetic change
close vowel
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])
to combine words/word formation
reading or phonetic value of a character
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
monosyllabic word
